allow: Bash(claude --model local "Write a simple hello world in Python")

Bash(#!/bin/bash
# Quick decision script to analyze current state

echo ""=== CONFIG FILE SUMMARY ===""
echo ""Total config files found:""
find . -name ""*config*"" -type f | grep -v venv | grep -v __pycache__ | wc -l

echo -e ""\nConfig files by location:""
find . -name ""*config*"" -type f | grep -v venv | grep -v __pycache__ | sed ''s|/[^/]*$||'' | sort | uniq -c

echo -e ""\nConfig files by type:""
find . -name ""*config*"" -type f | grep -v venv | grep -v __pycache__ | xargs -I {} basename {} | sort

echo -e ""\nDuplicate config names:""
find . -name ""*config*"" -type f | grep -v venv | grep -v __pycache__ | xargs -I {} basename {} | sort | uniq -c | grep -v ""1 ""

echo -e ""\nPython files using configs:""
grep -l ""config"" --include=""*.py"" -r . | grep -v __pycache__ | wc -l

echo -e ""\nPython files with config imports:""
grep -l ""import.*config\|from.*config"" --include=""*.py"" -r . | grep -v __pycache__ | head -10)
Bash(__NEW_LINE__ echo -e "\nChecking deleted files are gone...")
Bash(__NEW_LINE__ echo -e "\nPhase 1 cleanup successful! Ready for Phase 2.")
Bash(__NEW_LINE__ echo -e "\nüèÜ CONSOLIDATION SUCCESS: Your project is now optimally organized!")

import asyncio
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, ''/home/nathanael/mental-health-llm-evaluation'')
sys.path.insert(0, ''/home/nathanael/mental-health-llm-evaluation/src'')

try:
    from tests.load_testing import LoadTestRunner, LoadTestScenarios
    
    async def quick_load_test():
        print(''üöÄ Starting quick load test...'')
        
        config = LoadTestScenarios.get_baseline_test()
        config.concurrent_users = 5  # Reduced for demo
        config.test_duration_seconds = 10  # Very short test
        
        runner = LoadTestRunner(config)
        result = await runner.run_load_test()
        
        print(f''‚úÖ Load test completed!'')
        print(f''üìä Results: {result[""test_verdict""][""overall_pass""]}'')
        print(f''üìà Metrics summary available'')
        
        return result
    
    # Run the test
    result = asyncio.run(quick_load_test())
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f''‚ùå Load test error: {e}'')
")
